Zend_Gdata_MediaMimeStream

Zend_Gdata  
Gdata  
No 
No 

Description

A streaming Media MIME class that allows for buffered read operations.

Methods

__construct, closeFileHandle, getContentType, getTotalSize, read, wrapEntry,

__construct( string   $xmlString = null, string   $filePath = null, string   $fileContentType = null, ) : n/a

Description

Create a new MimeMediaStream object.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$xmlString string | The string corresponding to the XML section of the message, typically an atom entry or feed. null
$filePath string | The path to the file that constitutes the binary part of the message. null
$fileContentType string | The valid internet media type of the file. null

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Gdata_App_IOException If the file cannot be read or does not exist. Also if mbstring.func_overload has been set &gt; 1.

closeFileHandle( ) : void

Description

Close the internal file that we are streaming to the socket.

Return value

Type Description
void

getContentType( ) : string

Description

Return a Content-type header that includes the current boundary string.

Return value

Type Description
string A valid HTTP Content-Type header.

getTotalSize( ) : integer

Description

Return the total size of the mime message.

Return value

Type Description
integer Total size of the message to be sent.

read(   $bytesRequested, ) : string

Description

Read a specific chunk of the the MIME multipart message.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$bytesRequested n/a

Return value

Type Description
string A corresponding piece of the message. This could be binary or regular text.

wrapEntry(   $entry,   $fileMimeType, ) : void

Description

Sandwiches the entry body into a MIME message

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$entry n/a
$fileMimeType n/a

Return value

Type Description
void

$_boundaryString, $_currentPart, $_fileHandle, $_parts, $_totalSize,

  protected  $_boundaryString = null

A valid MIME boundary.string


  protected  $_currentPart = 0

The current part being read from.integer


  protected  $_fileHandle = null

A handle to the file that is part of the message.resource


  protected  $_parts = null

An array of all the parts to be sent. Array members are either a MimeFile or a MimeBodyString object.array

The size of the MIME message.integer
